questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription. You add guest users to the organization.
The company's global live event policy is configured as shown in the following exhibit.
//IMG//

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that completes each statement based on the information presented in the graphic.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Correct.
In the live event settings the "Everyone in the organisation" also include Guest users! 
"Everyone in the organization Users can create live events that people in your organization, including guest users added to your organization, can attend."
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-live-events/set-up-for-teams-live-events

comments.content:
A little more context:
"Everyone in the organization Users can create live events that people in your organization, including guest users added to your organization, can attend. Users can't create live events that are attended by anonymous users."

discussion.content:
Right: 
* Live Events Scheduling: Turning this on lets users in your organization create and schedule live events in Teams.
* Who can join scheduled live events: People in my organization Users can create live events that people in your organization, including guest users added to your organization, can attend.

Who can create a live event? Check out part "Who can create live events" in link below:
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/d077fec2-a058-483e-9ab5-1494afda578a
- a valid license
So given answer is correct.
- Full team membership in the org (canâ€™t be a guest or from another org).

I agree with the answer but answer two is really poor choice of wording. You need to be a licensed user to schedule the event don't you? An Azure AD user doesn't necessarily have a license, as Azure in and of itself is free.

comments.content: Sorry, if you change Who can join a schedule meeting to "Everyone" then anonymous users can join a meeting as well. No need to Org-Wide permission

discussion.content:
Correct.
Everyone in the organization Users can create live events that people in your organization, including guest users added to your organization, can attend. Users can't create live events that are attended by anonymous users. This setting enables the Org-wide permission type in Teams when a user schedules a live event.

Selected Answer: C
As of feb 2025 , global policies and setting has combined together therefore we can also enable this setting in meeting global setting.

Selected Answer: A
To allow or prevent meeting recordings

1. In the Microsoft Teams admin center, expand Meetings.
2. Select Meeting policies.
3. Select the policy that you want to edit.
4. Turn Meeting recording On or Off.
5. Select Save.

With PowerShell, you configure the -AllowCloudRecording parameter in Set-CsTeamsMeetingPolicy.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/meeting-recording?tabs=meeting-policy

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Teams.

A user named User1 reports that the recording button is unavailable during a Teams meeting.

You need to ensure that the recording button is available for User1.

What should you configure in the Microsoft Teams admin center?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer is correct.

There are three main options to find inactive teams 
Activity Report with Power Shell 
Microsoft Teams Usage Report in Office 365 
Identifying inactive Teams using activity threshold 

https://saketa.com/blog/identify-inactive-microsoft-teams-o365/

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Teams.

Your company requires that all inactive teams be deleted.

You need to identify teams that were inactive during the last 90 days.

What should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
This is the same question as Topic2 Question #61

Selected Answer: DE
D. Communication Credits:

Communication Credits are used for paying toll-free and premium call charges associated with Audio Conferencing in Microsoft Teams.
E. Microsoft 365 Audio Conferencing:

Microsoft 365 Audio Conferencing allows users to dial in to Teams meetings using a phone, and it includes toll-free numbers.
Option B (Microsoft Teams Domestic Calling Plan) is not directly related to toll-free numbers. Calling Plans are typically associated with providing domestic calling capabilities, but toll-free numbers usually require Communication Credits or Audio Conferencing licenses.

Options A (Microsoft Teams Rooms Pro) and C (Microsoft Teams Shared Devices) are related to hardware and devices for meeting rooms but are not required for users to join meetings by dialing toll-free numbers.

Therefore, the correct answers are D (Communication Credits) and E (Microsoft 365 Audio Conferencing).

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams. All users are assigned an Microsoft 365 E3 license.

You need to ensure that the users can join scheduled meetings by dialing a toll-free phone number.

Which two add-on licenses should you assign to the users? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

SIMULATION
-

A company named Contoso, Ltd. plans to deploy Teams Phone with location-based emergency dialing.

You need to ensure that when users dial emergency numbers, the call is routed based on the user's current location.

You do NOT need to configure networks and locations at this time.

To complete this task, sign in to the Microsoft 365 portal.
